12Perhaps more important evidence that policy changes were the main shocksaffecting the U.S. economy in the downturns of 1921 and 1938 is provided bythe fact that the few alternative explanations that have been advanced areeasily disproved. The policy hypotheses, in contrast, are completelyconsistent with the behavior of major economic variables.
